alert.note: Alert for Barton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Barton County through 700 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Great Bend, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Bend, Pawnee Rock, Albert, Olmitz, Great Bend Airport and Cheyenne Bottoms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
